verb.description: Think carefully about (something), typically before making a decision.
examples: each application is considered on its merits

phrases: She was taking it very well, all things considered.
Still, I don't think it's looking too bad, all things considered.
And if you decide, all things considered, to stay in and watch telly, you're in for a slow night - there isn't any.
It's not been a bad week, all things considered.
I don't think I fared too badly, all things considered.
origin: Late Middle English: from Old French considerer, from Latin considerare examine, perhaps based on sidus, sider- star.
